ent.origin: Mid 18th century: from the name of an imaginary race of brutish creatures in Swift's Gulliver's Travels (1726).

p.def: a rude, noisy, or violent person.

ent.origin: Mid 18th century: from the name of an imaginary race of brutish creatures in Swift's Gulliver's Travels (1726).

p.eg: One of the other girls gave her ponytail a yank.
Two steps and he was at my side, his hand wrapped in my hair, yanking my face up to him.
